item.name: Instance heartbeat
item.description: Database heartbeat -- developed (and not properly tested) by DBA team

item.name: Instance number of locked users
item.description: Details via: SELECT username||' '|| lock_date ||' '|| account_status FROM dba_users WHERE account_status IN('EXPIRED(GRACE)','LOCKED(TIMED)')

item.name: Instance memory allocated for bitmap index creation
Instance max number of open DB files
Instance flashback upper time limit
item.description: The upper limit (in minutes) on how far back in time the database may be flashed back. How far back one can flashback a database depends on how much flashback data Oracle has kept in the flash recovery area.

item.name: Instance distributed transactions locked resources timeout
item.description: Specifies the amount of time (in seconds) for distributed transactions to wait for locked resources.

item.name: Instance number of instances currently configured
Instance consistent gets
item.description: Number of times a consistent read was requested for a block.

item.name: Instance db block changes
item.description:
Closely related to "consistent changes", this statistic counts the total number of changes that were part of an update or delete operation that were made to all blocks in the SGA. Such changes generate redo log entries and hence become permanent changes to the database if the transaction is committed.
This approximates total database work. This statistic indicates the rate at which buffers are being dirtied (on a per-transaction or per-second basis, for example).

item.name: Instance db block gets
item.description: Number of times a CURRENT block was requested

item.name: Instance lob reads
item.description: Number of LOB API read operations performed in the session/system. A single LOB API read may correspond to multiple physical/logical disk block reads.

item.name: Instance lob writes
item.description: Number of LOB API write operations performed in the session/system. A single LOB API write may correspond to multiple physical/logical disk block writes.

item.name: Instance physical reads
item.description: Total number of data blocks read from disk. This value can be greater than the value of "physical reads direct" plus "physical reads cache" as reads into process private buffers also included in this statistic.

item.name: Instance physical reads direct
item.description: Number of reads directly from disk, bypassing the buffer cache. For example, in high bandwidth, data-intensive operations such as parallel query, reads of disk blocks bypass the buffer cache to maximize transfer rates and to prevent the premature aging of shared data blocks resident in the buffer cache.

item.name: Instance physical read total bytes
item.description: Total size in bytes of disk reads by all database instance activity including application reads, backup and recovery, and other utilities. The difference between this value and "physical read bytes" gives the total read size in bytes by non-application workload.

item.name: Instance physical writes direct
item.description: Number of writes directly to disk, bypassing the buffer cache (as in a direct load operation)

item.name: Instance physical write total bytes
item.description: Total size in bytes of all disk writes for the database instance including application activity, backup and recovery, and other utilities. The difference between this value and "physical write bytes" gives the total write size in bytes by non-application workload.

item.name: Instance redo writes
item.description: Total number of writes by LGWR to the redo log files. "redo blocks written" divided by this statistic equals the number of blocks per write writes.

item.name: Instance table scans (long tables)
item.description: Long (or conversely short) tables can be defined as tables that do not meet the short table criteria as described in table scans (short tables)

item.name: Instance table scans (short tables)
item.description: Long (or conversely short) tables can be defined by optimizer hints coming down into the row source access layer of Oracle. The table must have the CACHE option set.

item.name: Instance user I/O wait time
item.description: The total wait time (in centiseconds) for waits that belong to the User I/O wait class

discovery_rule.name: CommonItems
discovery_rule.params:
<parms type="oracle" prefix="oracle.">
<server>
<query time="60" item="heartbeat" nodata="0">SELECT DECODE(DUMMY,'X',1,0) FROM DUAL</query>
<discovery time="60" item="instance.discovery" names="INSTANCE">SELECT DISTINCT instance_name FROM v$instance</discovery>
<query time="60" item="instance.status[%1]">SELECT DISTINCT instance_name,status FROM v$instance</query>
<discovery time="60" item="tablespace.discovery" names="TABLESPACE">SELECT tablespace_name FROM dba_tablespaces WHERE contents NOT IN ('TEMPORARY','UNDO')</discovery>
<query time="60" item="tablespace.used_space[%1]">select t.tablespace_name, d.tbs_size-nvl(s.free_space, 0) used_bytes from ( select tablespace_name from dba_tablespaces where contents NOT IN ('TEMPORARY','UNDO') ) t, ( select SUM(nvl(bytes, 0)) tbs_size, SUM(decode(sign(nvl(maxbytes, 0) - nvl(bytes, 0)), -1, nvl(bytes, 0), nvl(maxbytes, 0))) tbs_maxsize, tablespace_name tablespace from dba_data_files group by tablespace_name ) d, ( select SUM(bytes) free_space, tablespace_name tablespace from dba_free_space group by tablespace_name ) s where t.tablespace_name = d.tablespace(+) and t.tablespace_name = s.tablespace(+) </query>
<query time="60" item="tablespace.maxsize[%1]">select t.tablespace_name, d.tbs_maxsize maxsize_bytes from ( select tablespace_name from dba_tablespaces where contents NOT IN ('TEMPORARY','UNDO') ) t, ( select SUM(nvl(bytes, 0)) tbs_size, SUM(decode(sign(nvl(maxbytes, 0) - nvl(bytes, 0)), -1, nvl(bytes, 0), nvl(maxbytes, 0))) tbs_maxsize, tablespace_name tablespace from dba_data_files group by tablespace_name ) d, ( select SUM(bytes) free_space, tablespace_name tablespace from dba_free_space group by tablespace_name ) s where t.tablespace_name = d.tablespace(+) and t.tablespace_name = s.tablespace(+) </query>
<query time="60" item="tablespace.available_space[%1]">select t.tablespace_name, d.tbs_maxsize - d.tbs_size + nvl(s.free_space, 0) space_bytes from ( select tablespace_name from dba_tablespaces where contents NOT IN ('TEMPORARY','UNDO') ) t, ( select SUM(nvl(bytes, 0)) tbs_size, SUM(decode(sign(nvl(maxbytes, 0) - nvl(bytes, 0)), -1, nvl(bytes, 0), nvl(maxbytes, 0))) tbs_maxsize, tablespace_name tablespace from dba_data_files group by tablespace_name ) d, ( select SUM(bytes) free_space, tablespace_name tablespace from dba_free_space group by tablespace_name ) s where t.tablespace_name = d.tablespace(+) and t.tablespace_name = s.tablespace(+) </query>
<query time="60" item="tablespace.percent_used[%1]">select t.tablespace_name, decode(d.tbs_maxsize, 0, 0, trunc((d.tbs_size-nvl(s.free_space, 0))*100/d.tbs_maxsize)) perc from ( select tablespace_name from dba_tablespaces where contents NOT IN ('TEMPORARY','UNDO') ) t, ( select SUM(nvl(bytes, 0)) tbs_size, SUM(decode(sign(nvl(maxbytes, 0) - nvl(bytes, 0)), -1, nvl(bytes, 0), nvl(maxbytes, 0))) tbs_maxsize, tablespace_name tablespace from dba_data_files group by tablespace_name ) d, ( select SUM(bytes) free_space, tablespace_name tablespace from dba_free_space group by tablespace_name ) s where t.tablespace_name = d.tablespace(+) and t.tablespace_name = s.tablespace(+) </query>
<query time="60" item="uptime" nodata="0">SELECT ROUND((sysdate-startup_time)*86400) retvalue FROM v$instance</query>
<query time="60" item="users_locked" nodata="none">SELECT username||' '|| lock_date ||' '|| account_status FROM dba_users where ACCOUNT_STATUS like 'EXPIRED(GRACE)' or ACCOUNT_STATUS like 'LOCKED(TIMED)' </query>
<query time="60" item="procnum">SELECT COUNT(*) procnum from v$process</query>
<query time="60" item="miss_latch">SELECT SUM(misses) FROM V$LATCH</query>
<discovery time="60" item="librarycache.discovery" names="LCNAMESPACE">SELECT DISTINCT namespace FROM v$librarycache</discovery>
<query time="60" item="librarycache.hitratio[%1]">SELECT namespace, gethitratio*100 get_pct FROM v$librarycache</query>
<query time="60" item="librarycache.pinhitratio[%1]">SELECT namespace, pins/(pins+reloads)*100 "pin_hit_ratio" FROM v$librarycache WHERE (pins+reloads)!=0</query>
<query time="60" item="locked_users" nodata="0">SELECT COUNT(*) AS c FROM dba_users WHERE account_status IN('EXPIRED(GRACE)','LOCKED(TIMED)')</query>
<query time="60" item="sessions" nodata="0">SELECT COUNT(*) FROM v$session</query>
<query time="60" item="session_system" nodata="0">SELECT COUNT(*) FROM v$session WHERE type='BACKGROUND'</query>
<query time="60" item="session_active" nodata="0">SELECT COUNT(*) FROM v$session WHERE type!='BACKGROUND' AND status='ACTIVE'</query>
<query time="60" item="session_inactive" nodata="0">SELECT COUNT(*) FROM v$session WHERE type!='BACKGROUND' AND status!='ACTIVE'</query>
<query time="60" item="users_connected" nodata="0">select count(username) from v$session where username is not null</query>
<query time="60" item="stats[%1]">SELECT REPLACE(name,' ','_'),value FROM sys.v_$sysstat WHERE name IN ('db block gets','consistent gets','user I/O wait time','physical reads','db block changes','physical reads direct','physical writes direct','redo writes','table scans (long tables)','table scans (short tables)','physical read total bytes','physical write total bytes','lob reads','lob writes')</query>
<query time="60" item="locks" nodata="none"> SELECT CASE (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM v$locked_object) WHEN 0 THEN NULL ELSE (SELECT b.session_id || ' ' || NVL(b.oracle_username, '(oracle)') || ' ' || a.owner || ' ' || a.object_name || ' ' || Decode(b.locked_mode, 0, 'None', 1, 'Null (NULL)', 2, 'Row-S (SS)', 3, 'Row-X (SX)', 4, 'Share (S)', 5, 'S/Row-X (SSX)', 6, 'Exclusive (X)', b.locked_mode) || ' ' || b.os_user_name locks FROM dba_objects a, v$locked_object b WHERE a.object_id = b.object_id ) END FROM DUAL </query>
<query time="60" item="maxcount[%1]">SELECT name,value FROM v$parameter WHERE name IN ('processes','sessions')</query>
<query time="120" item="dbfilesize">SELECT SUM(NVL(bytes,0)) val FROM dba_data_files</query>
<query time="180" item="dbsize"> SELECT SUM(NVL(a.bytes, 0) - NVL(f.bytes, 0)) val FROM sys.dba_tablespaces d, (SELECT tablespace_name, SUM(bytes) bytes FROM dba_data_files GROUP BY tablespace_name) a, (SELECT tablespace_name, SUM(bytes) bytes FROM dba_free_space GROUP BY tablespace_name) f WHERE d.tablespace_name = a.tablespace_name(+) AND d.tablespace_name = f.tablespace_name(+) AND NOT ( d.extent_management LIKE 'LOCAL' AND d.contents LIKE 'TEMPORARY' ) </query>
<query time="60" item="parameter[%1]">SELECT name,value FROM v$parameter WHERE name IN ('pga_aggregate_target','sga_target','sga_max_size','memory_target','memory_max_target','shared_pool_reserved_size','db_block_size','log_buffer','db_files','parallel_server_instances','cluster_database_instances','db_flashback_retention_target','distributed_lock_timeout','create_bitmap_area_size','bitmap_merge_area_size','hash_area_size','sort_area_size','cpu_count')</query>
<query time="300" item="name">SELECT ' - DB_NAME = <b>'||SYS_CONTEXT ('USERENV', 'DB_NAME') ||'</b> - INSTANCE_NAME = <b>' ||SYS_CONTEXT ('USERENV', 'INSTANCE_NAME')||'</b>' FROM dual</query>
<query time="60" item="dg_error" nodata="none">SELECT ERROR_CODE, SEVERITY, MESSAGE, TO_CHAR(TIMESTAMP, 'DD-MON-RR HH24:MI:SS') TIMESTAMP FROM V$DATAGUARD_STATUS WHERE CALLOUT='YES' AND TIMESTAMP > SYSDATE-1</query>
<query time="60" item="dg_sequence_number" nodata="0">SELECT MAX (sequence#) FROM v$log_history</query>
<query time="60" item="dg_sequence_number_stby" nodata="0">select max(sequence#) from v$archived_log</query>
<query time="600" item="archive" nodata="0">select round(A.LOGS*B.AVG/1024/1024/10) from ( SELECT COUNT (*) LOGS FROM V$LOG_HISTORY WHERE FIRST_TIME >= (sysdate -10/60/24)) A, ( SELECT Avg(BYTES) AVG, Count(1), Max(BYTES) Max_Bytes, Min(BYTES) Min_Bytes FROM v$log) B</query>
<query time="900" item="backup_check" nodata="999">SELECT NVL(MIN(time_frame),999) FROM (SELECT MIN(SYSDATE - start_time) time_frame FROM v$rman_status WHERE start_time > SYSDATE - 100 AND operation = 'BACKUP' AND status = 'COMPLETED' GROUP BY object_type HAVING object_type = 'DB FULL') </query>
<query time="1800" item="last_backup_status" nodata="NO_DATA_FOUND">SELECT NVL(MIN(status), 'NO_DATA_FOUND') bckstatus FROM (SELECT MIN(status) status FROM v$rman_status WHERE operation = 'BACKUP' AND status NOT LIKE 'RUNNING%' GROUP BY object_type, recid HAVING object_type = 'DB FULL' ORDER BY recid DESC) WHERE ROWNUM = 1 </query>
<query time="3600" item="delete_old_archlogs_check" nodata="999">SELECT MIN(SYSDATE - start_time) FROM v$rman_status WHERE start_time > SYSDATE - 100 AND operation IN ('DELETE', 'BACKUP') AND status = 'COMPLETED' GROUP BY object_type HAVING object_type = 'ARCHIVELOG'</query>
<query time="60" item="db_cpu_microseconds" nodata="0">select value from sys.V_$SYS_TIME_MODEL where stat_name ='DB CPU'</query>
<query time="60" item="background_without_rman_cpu_microseconds" nodata="0">with a as (select /*+materialize*/ SUBSTR(UPPER(STAT_NAME),1,1) sname, value from sys.V_$SYS_TIME_MODEL where stat_name = 'background cpu time' OR UPPER(stat_name) LIKE 'RMAN%CPU%TIME%') select (select value from a where sname = 'B')-(select value from a where sname = 'R') from dual</query>
<query time="60" item="rman_cpu_microseconds" nodata="0">select value from sys.V_$SYS_TIME_MODEL where UPPER(stat_name) LIKE 'RMAN%%CPU%TIME%'</query>
</server>
</parms>

trigger.name: Backup database on {HOSTNAME}
trigger.description: Database backup not performed on {HOSTNAME} in time as required

trigger.name: Delete old archivelogs on {HOSTNAME}
trigger.description: Archive logs not deleted on {HOSTNAME} in time as required

trigger.name: Last Backup Status of {HOSTNAME}
trigger.description: Status of the last backup of {HOSTNAME}

trigger.name: No data for oracle instance {HOST.NAME} for 2 minutes
trigger.description: The trapper didn't send any data in the last 2 minutes. Check the DBforBIX daemon, the network connection and the database status.
